title: Microsoft’s Satya Nadella is choosing chatbots over podcasts
summary: While Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella says he likes podcasts, he might not actually be listening to them anymore. title: MIT disavows doctoral student paper on AI’s productivity benefits
summary: MIT says that due to concerns about the “integrity” of a high-profile paper about the effects of artificial intelligence on research and innovation, the paper should be “withdrawn from public discourse.” The paper in question, “Artificial Intelligence, Scientific Discovery, and Product Innovation,” was written by a doctoral student in the university’s economics program. It claimed […]

title: Laser-powered fusion experiment more than doubles its power output
summary: The U.S. Department of Energy’s National Ignition Facility increased the yield of the experiment in recent attempts.

title: Epic Games asks judge to force Apple to approve Fortnite
summary: Epic Games is escalating its efforts to pressure Apple to allow its game Fortnite into its App Store, with a new court filing asking Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers to require that Apple “accept any compliant version of Fortnite onto the U.S. storefront of the App Store.” Epic and Apple have been engaged in a years-long […]

title: Y Combinator startup Firecrawl is ready to pay $1M to hire three AI agents as employees
summary: Y Combinator startup Firecrawl is back on the hunt for AI agent employees, after a previous attempt to hire one didn't go as planned.

title: Build, don’t bind: Accel’s Sonali De Rycker on Europe’s AI crossroads
summary: Sonali De Rycker, a general partner at Accel and one of Europe’s most influential venture capitalists, is bullish about the continent’s prospects in AI. summary: OpenAI is poised to help develop a staggering 5-gigawatt data center campus in Abu Dhabi, positioning the company as a primary anchor tenant in what could become one of the world’s largest AI infrastructure projects, according to a new Bloomberg report. title: How Silicon Valley’s influence in Washington benefits the tech elite
summary: Since Donald Trump took office, more than three dozen employees, allies, and investors of Musk, Peter Thiel, Marc Andreessen, and Palmer Luckey have taken roles at federal agencies, helping direct billions in contracts to their companies.

title: US man who hacked SEC’s X account to spike Bitcoin price sentenced to prison
summary: The Department of Justice announced Eric Council Jr. was sentenced to 14 months in prison for the hack.

title: Arc’s new 24-foot electric boat is its cheapest yet
summary: Electric boat startup Arc has a new model that is its cheapest and most approachable watercraft yet. The new boat is called the Arc Coast, and it will start at $168,000. title: TechCrunch and VivaTech partner for the VivaTech Innovation of the Year
summary: TechCrunch is joining forces with VivaTech, Europe’s biggest startup and tech event, to select startups for the prestigious VivaTech Innovation of the Year at VivaTech 2025. title: Spotify responds to backlash over public podcast play counts
summary: Spotify announced last week that it would roll out public play counts on all podcasts as a way of “helping attract new fans.” But podcasters swiftly responded with criticism of the new feature — mainly, that it would further promote podcasts that already have large audiences while making smaller shows less appealing to new listeners.
